results.definition: an exclusive circle of people with a common purpose
establish or set up a camp
a site where care and activities are provided for children during the summer months
examples: city kids get to see the country at a summer camp

results.definition: shelter for persons displaced by war or political oppression or for religious beliefs
temporary living quarters specially built by the army for soldiers
examples: wherever he went in the camp the men were grumbling

results.definition: live in or as if in a tent
examples: Can we go camping again this summer?
The houseguests had to camp in the living room

results.definition: providing sophisticated amusement by virtue of having artificially (and vulgarly) mannered or banal or sentimental qualities
examples: they played up the silliness of their roles for camp effect

results.definition: a group of people living together in a camp
examples: the whole camp laughed at his mistake

results.definition: a penal institution (often for forced labor)
examples: China has many camps for political prisoners

results.definition: give an artificially banal or sexual quality to
something that is considered amusing not because of its originality but because of its unoriginality
examples: the living room was pure camp

results.definition: temporary lodgings in the country for travelers or vacationers
examples: level ground is best for parking and camp areas
